title: Columbia University President Minouche Shafik Resigns After Failure to Stop Antisemitism
message:
Columbia University President Minouche Shafik resigned Wednesday after she failed to prevent radical anti-Israel and antisemitic “encampments” on campus that led eventually to the violent occupation of a university building.
The Columbia Spectator reported:University President Minouche Shafik will resign from her post effective Aug. 14, Shafik wrote in a Wednesday email to the Columbia community.
During her time as president, Shafik faced fierce national scrutiny for her administration’s handling of pro-Palestinian student protests, academic freedom, and on-campus antisemitism.
The university, which was slow to react, suspended some pro-Palestinian organizations, but their members continued to participate in campus protests.
And three deans resigned last week over text messages during the crisis that mocked students who were complaining about antisemitism.

title: Columbia President Minouche Shafik steps down months after protests over Israel - Hamas war gripped campus
message:
By Matt Egan and Elisabeth Buchwald, CNN(CNN) — Columbia University President Minouche Shafik is stepping down months after protests over the Israel-Hamas war gripped the campus, Shafik announced in a letter sent Wednesday to the Columbia community.
Criticism over campus protestsShafik came under criticism for her handling of protests on campus over the Israel-Hamas war.
Jewish students and faculty have been mocked, harassed, and assaulted simply for their identity,” Foxx said in a statement.
“After failing to protect Jewish students and negotiating with pro-Hamas terrorists, this forced resignation is long overdue,” Stefanik said in a statement.
Like Shafik, university presidents struggled to find a balance between protecting students’ freedom to protest and ensuring the safety of all students.

title: A timeline of Minouche Shafik tenure as president of Columbia University
message:
Minouche Shafik was not even halfway through her first semester as president of Columbia University when protests related to the Israel-Hamas war began reverberating through college campuses across the United States.
Here is a timeline of Shafik’s tenure at the university:AdvertisementJan. 18, 2023The university’s board of trustees announces that Shafik, then the president of the London School of Economics and Political Science, will be the 20th president of Columbia.
July 1, 2023Soon after Shafik’s first day as president, July 1, she tells Columbia Magazine that her leadership philosophy centers on leading from behind when possible.
In attendance are hundreds of protesters, including postdoctoral workers seeking a new contract and a group objecting to the university’s mismanagement of decades of patient sexual abuse by a former Columbia University Medical Center gynecologist, Robert A. Hadden.
More than 100 students at Columbia University and its sister school, Barnard College, are arrested.

title: Festival for Falastin helps Comox Valley residents bear witness to crisis
message:
Event continuing with 6 p.m. dinner, panel discussion and entertainmentFestival for Falastin is currently underway in Cumberland.
The event features workshops, activities and a silent auction.
This evening will feature a Palestinian dinner, panel discussion, music and dancing.
One of the workshops this afternoon is on antisemitism and how common narratives can conflate support for Palestinian causes with being antisemitic.
Tickets are available at the door, and are on a sliding scale to ensure equitable access to all.

title: Tim Walz is Just Like You and Me | Frontpage Mag
message:
Getting your Trinity Audio player ready...[Order a copy of Robert Spencer’s forthcoming book, Muhammad: A Critical Biography, by clicking here.]
Tim Walz should be our vice president, our self-appointed moral superiors inform us because he is a guy just like you and me and the fellow grilling hamburgers next door.
Walz, the “news” media insists, is the real deal, an Ordinary Joe, even more ordinary than Old Joe Biden.
Nevertheless, Walz happily appeared at CAIR-Minnesota’s 2019 “Challenging Islamophobia” conference.
Nor has any leftist “journalist” demanded that Walz disavow “Islamophobia” professor Hatem Bazian, who was also at that conference.

title: Disney  Snow White  Star , Rachel Zegler , Under Fire for Egging On Antisemitic Attacks on Israeli Co - Star , Gal Gadot
message:
As a major Hollywood star who’s unabashed in her public support of Israel, Ms. Gadot has faced antisemitic attacks online in the days following the trailer’s release.
While some of the commenters voiced their support for Ms. Zegler’s pro-Palestinian message, her post was overwhelmingly flooded with criticism and support for Ms. Gadot.
She’s getting her second big break in Disney’s Snow White thanks to Gal Gadot’s star power,” a political influencer, the Persian Jewess, wrote in a post on X.
This is not the first time that Ms. Zegler has voiced her opinions on the war in the Middle East.
Ms. Gadot even helped to facilitate a Los Angeles screening of a graphic 47-minute video showing Hamas’s atrocities on October 7.

title: 15 | August | 2024 | RUTHFULLY YOURS
message:
A 37-year-old male neurosurgical epilepsy patient at Tel Aviv’s Ichilov (Sourasky) Medical Center was implanted with depth electrodes.
The system was originally developed at Israel’s Sheba Medical Center.
(TY Yanky) Israeli NGO The Protective Partnership has started a free one-day retreat in Herzliya, called the Villa.
Israeli NGO Startup Nation Central is helping Tzafon Medical Center (Poriya hospital) near Tiberias become a regional leader in health tech innovation and entrepreneurship.
Take care if you ask to see the “Sister” at the Galilee Medical Center in Nahariya.

title: I was there to see Minouche Shafik promise to encourage vigorous debate fall flat
message:
Columbia University President Nemat “Minouche” Shafik has resigned months after protests about Israel’s war on Gaza gripped the New York institution.
An Egyptian-British economist, Ms Shafik joined Columbia in July last year as the Ivy League school’s first Arab, Muslim and female president.
The Hamilton Hall action lasted about 24 hours before Ms Shafik authorised another raid.
We were kept away from any line of sight to Hamilton Hall while officers reportedly brutalised students during arrests.
One fired a gun inside Hamilton Hall.

title: Police review  hate incident  at Reginald D Hunter comedy gig
message:
The US comedian, 55, issued a statement on Thursday, saying he regretted an “unfortunate incident” at his Edinburgh Festival Fringe show.
When asked about his gig, a Police Scotland spokeswoman said: “We have been made aware of a hate incident, which reportedly took place at an event in Edinburgh on Sunday August 11.
Hunter posted a statement on his social media accounts saying: “There was an unfortunate incident in my new show Fluffy Fluffy Beaver.
In 2006, a promotion poster for his comedy shows was banned with London Underground saying at the time it was “likely to offend”.
Hunter and the Edinburgh venue have been contacted for additional comment.

title: The Jewish people draw strength from the traumas of their past
message:
Our personal health timeline is important and can indicate the weaknesses and strengths of the body we have carried since birth.
Yet, counter to paralyzing us, allowing this history to be passed on to those who have survived history has inspired the opposite response.
A play on the typical benign Jewish line, where will you be for Shabbat or Yom Tov?
Through my work with the Jewish Federations of Canada, I see these same qualities in the history of our ongoing philanthropic relationships in Israel, from Metulla to Eilat.
The citizens of Be’er Sheva, Sderot, and Eilat, the historic partnership cities of Montreal and Toronto federations, echo these sentiments.

title: Book Club : Brodesser - Akner  Long Island Compromise  Intro
message:
Photo-Illustration: New York MagazineThis discussion originally appeared in Beach Read Book Club, a limited-run newsletter where New York staff discuss the season’s buzziest books alongside our readers.
Welcome to the first meeting of New York’s 2024 Beach Read Book Club.
It’s very episodic; the characters are introduced in a really TV way.
Then you’re watching how long the rot can happen before it actually disrupts the superficial thing.
Beach Read Book Club is moderated by Jasmine Vojdani.

title: Inside NSW Liberal council election debacle
message:
As soon as the event ended, Gannon, Pandeleos and the rest of the team high-tailed it to Liberal Party headquarters on Macquarie Street to fill in their forms.
NSW Liberal Party state director Richard Shields.
Among shell-shocked MPs, candidates and other party members, the question everyone was still grappling with was: how did this fiasco happen?
NSW Liberal Party president Don Harwin.
Downward slope: A now-deleted Facebook post by Woollahra Council showing mayor Richard Shields opening a playground on Wednesday morning.
